The Gibson ex-Huberman Stradivarius (1713) Stradivari, Antonio of Cremona 1713 Musical Instrument, Violin Stradivarius Violin, twice stolen from Branislaw Huberman, first for short time, then for 51 years. Recovered after deathbed confession by Julian Altman who bequeathed it to his wife, who received a finder's fee of 263,000 dollars. Purchased for four million dollars by Joshua Bell in 2002.
